intro: Ludwigia affinis, commonly known as the red Ludwigia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant typically grows in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments, often found in slow-moving freshwater habitats. Its leaves are usually oval or elliptic, and they can vary in color from bright green to reddish tones. Ludwigia affinis is popular in aquariums and water gardens due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
